experience: You and Michael both know Jim Skidmore, Greg Crandall, and 14 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017

-Manage all aspects of development/management for online money movement including wires, ACH transfers, deposits, check requests, and billpay across multiple platforms.-Facilitate project management functions, including scope development and management, requirements analysis, scheduling, deliverables management and planning for multiple concurrent projects.-Create product roadmaps, vision documents and investment cases for large scale projects across multiple domains.-Develop business requirements for Agile and Waterfall (RUP) projects to execute product vision.-Provide ongoing analysis and support for all online money movement data through project functions, including web accessibility, user experience design, account information management and vendor solutions.-Work closely with business partners to coordinate and manage client data reporting strategies and deliver recommendations that drive results.

-Oversee and contribute to projects from inception to launch, including; requirements gathering, user acceptance, coordination and implementation across internal and external teams, and providing post launch support.-Build credibility, establish rapport, and maintain communication with stakeholders at multiple levels, including those internal and external to the organization.-Work with various business partners throughout the firm to help uncover potential risks involving our cashiering systems.-Initiate cashiering system modifications, expansions, and coordinate the testing with various business partners for new system releases.-Responsible for ad hoc research reports including large data pulls utilizing Teradata or SQL and presenting the information to Executive level business partners.-Write cashiering business requirements and act as the liaison between business, compliance, legal, and technology partners.

-Assisted management with the completion and sign-off on all reports and provide approvals as needed.-Assisted manager with addressing employee performance problems promptly and directly in accordance with company personnel policies and procedures.-Helped plan and monitor daily staffing schedules and adjust accordingly to ensure adequate staffing levels that support operational demands and business objectives.-Handled escalated phone calls and emails to provide the best possible client experience.-Responsible for updating policies and procedures as needed.-Actively participated with management in the interview process for potential employees.-Responsible for various projects including the transition of Bank wires from paper format into an imaging system.

-Responsible for daily balancing of Schwab Bank General Ledger accounts and monthly reporting to Senior Management.-Recommended and initiated changes to the Reconciliation of Schwab Bank General Ledger accounts saving the company several full time employee hours per day. -Developed new procedures for employees to reconcile the Schwab Bank General Ledger accounts.-Partnered with Management in various Schwab Bank Operations departments to resolve breaks in the reconciliations.

-Worked with management in developing and implementing new ideas to improve our current processes and client experience.-Completed daily reconciliation and analysis of Schwab General Ledger accounts against external vendor accounts.-Maintained excellent working relationships with various Schwab departments including Chairmen’s Division, Dividends, Margins, Risk, Retail Operations, Retirement Plan Services, and Schwab Institutional.-Responsible for training and developing team members with new Cash Control, Incoming Wires, and Moneylink functions from San Francisco. -Responsible for risk monitoring of incoming wires to ensure they fall within OFAC guidelines.-Researched, escalated, and problem solving in regards to wires, journals, checks, and various operational tasks.
